info.game_comments: (Cheryl: Get a taste of the good life--today on Jeopardy!)

(2, 1).clue: "The Rose" with Bette Midler was loosely based on the life of this rocker

(3, 1).clue: All Don Knotts' greatness lay ahead of him when he was born July 21, 1924 in Morgantown in this state

(4, 1).clue: This singer's name is on a line of "Fresh taste. Fast!" precooked sausage links and patties

(5, 1).clue: To find the new clothing line this singer launched in October 2001, look J-Hi & J-Lo

(6, 1).clue: Kuwaitis don't have to shell out their dinars for medical care; profits from this export make it free for all

(2, 2).clue: "We Will Rock You" is the title of the 1983 film about this band's live concert in Montreal, Canada

(3, 2).clue: Jim & Artie's most diabolical for on this TV show was the evil Dr. Loveless, played by Michael Dunn

(4, 2).clue: "The Audrey Hepburn Story" starring Jennifer Love Hewitt starts off during the filming of this movie

(5, 2).clue: The teen version of this magazine launched in 1999 dropped the "politan" for "girl"

(6, 2).clue: To buy a sedan chair in this capital of Sudan, you can use dinars or the old Sudanese pound

(2, 3).clue: A high school boy gets a chance to tag along with an up & coming rock band in this 2000 film directed by Cameron Crowe

(3, 3).clue: It's the southernmost city in the 48 contiguous states

(4, 3).clue: Herb Peterson developed this famous fast food breakfast item introduced in 1973

(5, 3).clue: To help with the launch of the new sitcom, CBS had her host the 2001 Emmys

(6, 3).clue: To tip at resorts on the shores of Tripoli in this African country, use dinars

(2, 4).clue: As the cross-dressing Dr. Frank N. Furter in "The Rocky Horror Picture Show", he led the frivolities

(3, 4).clue: This large territory would make up the majority of a proposed Palestinian state

(4, 4).clue: Superstition says foam on your tea or coffee, like an itchy palm, means you're going to get this

(5, 4).clue: 2001 saw the launch of Rockstarbaby, an infant wear line from Tico Torres, this group's drummer

(6, 4).clue: Use dinars to buy a Dido record in this modern country where Carthage was once ruled by a Queen Dido

(2, 5).clue: This Oscar-winning actor wrote or co-wrote many of the songs in the retro '60s movie "That Thing You Do"

(3, 5).clue: Paul Baumer is the literary narrator of this classic novel of World War I
(3, 5).correct response: All Quiet on the Western Front

(4, 5).clue: Before W.K. Kellogg, C.W. Post was making breakfast cereals in this city

(6, 5).clue: The dinar is the money you'll use in Manama, the capital of this former British protectorate off Saudi Arabia

(1, 1).clue: This canal linking the Great Lakes to the Atlantic was opened in 1825

(2, 1).clue: (Cheryl will give the clue.) There are two classic beverages to serve with caviar: champagne, & this type of liquor, which should be iced

(3, 1).clue: In Pope's "The Rape of the Lock", "rape" means abduction & the lock is a lock of this

(5, 1).clue: Americans grouse about cold winds from Canada; Bulgarians, about cold winds from this even larger country

(6, 1).clue: Full coverage of a trial goes from this to this

(2, 2).clue: If you want to emulate this author who created 007, try some Osetra caviar-- he adored it

(4, 2).clue: In 1986 she married Bob Kersee & gave up basketball to focus on the heptathlon

(6, 2).clue: (Sofia gives the clue at the feet of Jimmy.)  Please get that I'm doing this!  Please!  I promise I'll never do it again!  Please!
